name: Foster Harris House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Foster Harris B&B is such a wonderful place. John and Diane definitely run a tight ship as the service is absolutely outstanding the the accomodations are superb. The view from our room was beautiful. My favorite part of our stay was the 4-course breakfast the was prepared for us in the morning. This is a geat place -- highly recommended!
reviews.title: AMAZING PLACE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Foster Harris House is located in a charming small town in the foothills of the Appalachians and run by a delightful and friendly couple who not only make you feel at home but stuff you with a fantastic breakfast (by Chef John) that outdoes the cooking of the Inn at Little Washington, which is just a 5-10 minute walk away. It would be a wonderful base for biking in the foothills; they actually offer bicycle holidays, rent bicycles, etc. If you can find an excuse (or even if you can't), by all means stay there!
reviews.title: Great B&B!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well-maintained B&B within walking distance of Inn at Little Washington. John and Diane have done a fantastic job with this property, and you can tell how much they love what they do from the attention to detail and guest service. They have a great understanding of the guests who come to Washington, VA (i.e., generally folks who like good food and wine) and operate the B&B to match those tastes. The house has quiet rooms and nice, private bathrooms. Beautiful setting with a nice yard to sit and read or relax or play catch with Stella the yellow lab. The breakfast was fantastic -- even after a dinner at the Inn at Little Washington the night before, the breakfast at Foster Harris was memorable as well. Wish we could have spent more time there. Foster Harris House is a great choice for a B&B in Washington, and we'll definitely be back the first chance we get.
reviews.title: Great B&B; Walk to Dinner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With the overwhelming chorus of good reviews, mine is hardly needed, but the Inn is run so well and so thoughtfully that it is worth this redundant mention. I am in the midst of doing research for a trip further down South and find myself searching for the experience that FHH provides: service, relaxation, comfort, fine dining. I loved the little touches -- the Lindt chocolates at bedside, coffee outside the door before breakfast, and even a make-up towel in the bathroom. We stayed only a night, for dinner at the Inn at Little Washington, on our way up to DC for the Fourth, and wish we could have stayed longer and taken advantage of the bikes and tranquil surroundings. I fell off the last bike I tried to ride, but otherwise their Tour d'Epicure looks like a fantastic addition to the Central Virginia scene. Although I need to save money for a France trip, I find myself tempted to take advantage of a repeat customer deal they are offering through August.
reviews.title: Wonderful - as promised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at Foster Harris House initiated us to the Bed and Breakfast theme in a way that will be difficult to improve on. The house is tranquil, beautiful, and poetic both inside and out. John and Diane helped us feel at home and comfortable with the other guests. John was able to produce a wonderfully chilled Riesling within minutes of our request at arrival. He also maintains an open bottle of delicious 2001 Dow Port with glasses on a silver serving tray for guest to self-serve as they lounge in the comfortable living room.
reviews.title: Warmth and comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Foster Harris House for 2 nights over the Thanksgiving weekend. We haven't stayed in a B&B in the last 10 years after several truly horrendous experiences. I read the reviews on Tripadvisor and decided to give the Foster Harris House a shot. What we found was a delightful, fresh, and hip version of a country inn. The inn is immaculate and the furnishings new and comfortable- no old or musty smelling couches or mattresses. The bathrooms were updated but still kept the integrity of the original building.
reviews.title: Not your parents B&B!

likes.liked: — Modern twist on B&B's and Location
likes.disliked: — Breakfast was served at 9:30 which is a little late for us.

reviews.text: The FHH is run by a fun, intelligent and modern couple who seem to have the ability to anticipate guests needs before the guests themselves. We were warmly greeted with a glass of wine and offered books and maps of the area.
reviews.title: Amazing

likes.liked: — The food and the view of the mountains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The value is extraordinary. You will not be nickel and dimed here! A free gourmet breakfast, free telephone calls anywhere in the US, free internet on house computer, free soda and bottled water, and a concierge service to match any.....all available 24 hours.
reviews.title: fantastic attention to detail...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back to the breakfast! We were served a breakfast which was, without a doubt, the best breakfast I have ever experienced. The food was thoughtful, clever, fresh and most importantly,..... scrumptious..... all plated in such an artistic manner that we were hesitant to eat it! (As a side note, after eating breakfast, we hiked ten miles and skipped lunch because we were still full!)
reviews.title: Tour d Epicure great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend the Foster Harris House to anyone, especially those who don't think a little country inn could meet his/her high standards,,,, it will certainly exceed them and leave you anxious for your next visit.
reviews.title: Had a wonderful time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't agree more with the prior comments that gave this B&B the highest ratings. We too recently spent a night at the Foster Harris House as part of a special birthday and a dinner at the Inn at Little Washington, and it was memorable in every way. We arrived to a warm welcome and soon were sunning ourselves on the Adirondack chairs in the yard while drinking red wine (in red wine glasses!) and snacking on nuts provided by hosts, Diane and John. What a relaxing and beautiful view! The rooms were nicely furnished and airy. The rooms also are well lit if you desire to read. The breakfast -- served outside on the deck -- was very enjoyable, tasty and did not leave us with that heavy feel. The scones were warm and delicious. There's also plenty to do in the area including driving through the countryside, shopping, eating (of course), and the promise of bicycling -- offered through this B&B -- is a sure thing to please.
reviews.title: A wonderful experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having chosen The Inn at Little Washington for our annual anniversary dinner, we decided to spend the night in the town but were looking for an alternative to the very high prices for romms at "The Inn". The Foster Harris House has a beautiful and user friendly website which was also indicative of the appointmens and service that were rendered. John and Diane MacPherson anticipated a guest's every need and desire. We plan to return again. The rooms were an excellent value. The Tour d'Epicure sounds like something we would like to come back to enjoy.
reviews.title: High quality and superior, well-presented breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Debbie and Bill (Northern Virginia)
reviews.title: Attention to every detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to the Inn for our 40th wedding anniversary. The last time we went, we stayed at the Inn, which was perfect, of course.
reviews.title: Terrific stay at the Foster Harris House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Foster Harris is 2 short blocks away and was a wonderful alternative. Arrival wine, lovely young couple, pristine house, great bed, soft linens (they use the same service as the Inn). And the breakfast was 4 course and to die for!
reviews.title: Really Nice B&B for the non-B&B Crowd

likes.disliked: — Felt a tad rushed at checkout...there is a definite schedule at the Foster Harris House.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were able to get a reservation at the Foster Harris House for a recent trip to Washington. While dinner at The Inn is always well worth the trip, staying with John and Diane made this trip truly special. You couldnt ask for more welcoming hosts, they were both personable and extremely knowledgable about the local area and its attractions. You truly felt like a welcome guest, if not a member of the family. The house itself was perfect for a B&B - the rooms were charming, the ammenities were superb, and the common areas and grounds were comfortable and welcoming. Finally, I would be remiss if I forgot to mention John's breakfast - it was a wonderful preparation of the finest ingredients. John and Diane's pride in their house and in their local community came through in the finest sence.
reviews.title: Couldnt have been better

likes.liked: — The feeling of welcome from the owners and the house itself

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am looking forward to going back soon, whether just for another dinner trip to Washington, or even better for a bike ride with the Tour d'epicure. In the meantime, I would enthusiastically recommend the Foster Harris House to anyone going through the area.
reviews.title: B&B Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything is wonderful about this B&B, especially the owners. Their B&B is a gem.
reviews.title: Exceeded our expectations

likes.disliked: — We really did not have any dislikes

reviews.title: Expensive, but no more than nearby B&Bs
reviews.text: My wife and I selected this property based on a referral from a relative. Our stay at the Foster Harris House was the perfect complement to our dinner at the Inn at Little Washington. Diane greeted us at the door when we arrived, showed us to our room, and then offered us a glass of wine as we settled in. The room was very well-appointed, the bath totally renovated, and everything else was just right. Even the linens were extra luxurious. The highlight was the four course breakfast that we enjoyed the next morning. John is a first-class chef and treated us to a truly gourmet meal. We highly recommend the Foster Harris House for any visitor to Washington, Virginia.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very comfortable room and public areas, pleasant hosts, wonderful breakfast. Extras included glasses of wine when you arrived, port available in the public area and wifi (although the signal was only fair).
reviews.title: Great Stay!

description: Just steps from the world-renowned Inn at Little Washington in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains, the Foster Harris House offers comfortable, refined country inn accommodations in an enchanting setting. Each queen bed guest room has exquisitely soft linens, spa robes, and a private bath with a rainfall shower. Most rooms offer expansive views of the surrounding countryside. Enjoy afternoon wine upon arrival and awaken to a lavish, unhurried four-course breakfast.
